channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024120272
item.description:
Report E-2024120272

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-07T00:48:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-27
  • City: MOSHEIM
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Holston Gases, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 127250
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver had been making propane deliveries during the remnants of Hurricane Helene. Weather conditions were rainy with very high gusty winds. Driver stated that heavy wind gust caught the truck and pushed the truck toward the shoulder of the roadway. Right side tires dropped off the asphalt and when the driver corrected truck proceeded to overturn in the roadway and rolled coming to a stop on its side. Impact from the rollover damage one of the vapor return valves on the back of the truck and it started leaking propane. Area was secured when law enforcement arrived at the scene. Roadway was closed due to leaking propane. Fire Department and Greenville TN Hazmat team also responded to the site. Response team connected a vapor hose to the truck and routed it away from the truck so that vapor could be flared off to reduce the vapor pressure in the tank. Once the vapor pressure the was reduced the leak subsequently stopped so that the truck could be returned to its wheels and towed from the site.

item.title: Report E-2025010400
item.description:
Report E-2025010400

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-09
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FUEL SOUTH EXPRESS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4998
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0745 ET, Danny Mabry with Circle K store # 4703699 notified ERTS of a premium gasoline release located in Murfreesboro, TN. It was reported that approximately 30 gallons released from Fuel South Express due to overfill. The release impacted concrete only. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. At 0920 on 1/9/25 HEPACO arrived onsite to the gasoline release. The gasoline that spilled impacted a 60' x 5' area on the asphalt parking lot. Oil dry is already placed down on the spill. The 30 gallon spill estimate is accurate. HEPACO worked on sweeping up the oil dry and will apply more after. HEPACO generated 2 55-gallon metal drums of gasoline impacted absorbents
